thread.title: Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger practiced on Wednesday
thread.title_full: Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger practiced on Wednesday

author: azcentral.com
title: Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger practiced on Wednesday
text:
Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger practiced on Wednesday for the first time since suffering a sprained knee three weeks ago.
Roethlisberger was listed as “limited” on the injury report, and there has been speculation that he will try to play against the Cardinals because of his close connection with Arians.
But it seems doubtful Roethlisberger would play since the timetable for his return was set at four to six weeks.
AZCENTRAL
Cardinals XTRA app: Get the latest news, analysis, scores, more
Steelers coach Mike Tomlin said “we’ll see” when asked if it’s realistic to expect Roethlisberger to play.
Mike Vick, who signed with the Steelers in late August, has started in place of Roethlisberger. Because Vick is new to the team, he’s running a scaled-back version of the offense.
“It’s growing every day,” Tomlin said of Vick’s knowledge of the offense. “I imagine it will be more this week than it was last week. I know it was more last week than it was in St. Louis. It’s just a process that we’re going through.”
AZCENTRAL
Arizona Cardinals' Dwight Freeney in action immediately
Arians said he would like to see Roethlisberger play if the quarterback is healthy.
"He’s such a great player and the league needs him," Arians said.
Roster move
The Cardinals placed safety Chris Clemons (hamstring) on injured reserve and promoted cornerback Cariel Brooks from the practice squad.
They signed safety Durell Eskridge to the practice squad. A rookie, Eskridge signed with the Jets as an undrafted rookie out of Syracuse. He was released Sept. 5.
Injury report
Safety Tyrann Mathieu (heel), receiver John Brown (hamstring) and Woodley (chest) did not practice on Wednesday. Arians said he expects them to participate in Thursday’s work.
Cornerback Justin Bethel (foot), tight end Darren Fells (hip), safety Tony Jefferson (neck) and safety Rashad Johnson (hip) were limited.
For the Steelers, safety Will Allen (ankle), linebacker Jarvis Jones and center Doug Legursky (back), did not practice. Roethlisberger, cornerback Cortez Allen (knee) and linebacker Ryan Shazier (shoulder) were limited.
Up next: Cardinals at Steelers
When : Sunday at 10 a.m.
Where : Heinz Field, Pittsburgh
TV : Channel 10.
